      • Field Detail

        • public static final java.lang.String AJAX_HEADER

          Default value for the name of the Ajax header.

        • public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_TARGET_PARAMETER

        • public static final java.lang.String NO_ROLE

          Used to ensure that all authenticated users have at least one granted authority to work around Spring Security code that assumes at least one. By granting this non-authority, the user can't do anything but gets past the somewhat arbitrary restrictions.

        • public static final java.lang.String SAVED_REQUEST

        • public static final java.lang.String SPRING_SECURITY_LAST_USERNAME_KEY

      • Method Detail

        • public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> authoritiesToRoles(java.lang.Object authorities)

          Extract the role names from authorities.

          Parameters:
          authorities - the authorities (a collection or array of org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority).
          Returns:
          the names

        • public static void clientRegisterFilter(java.lang.String beanName, SecurityFilterPosition order)

          Register a filter in a specified position in the chain.

          Note - this is for use in application code after the plugin has initialized, e.g. in BootStrap where you want to register a custom filter in the correct order without dealing with the existing configured filters.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
          order - the position

        • @java.lang.SuppressWarningsssWarnings("deprecation") public public static void clientRegisterFilter(java.lang.String beanName, int order)

          Register a filter in a specified position in the chain.

          Note - this is for use in application code after the plugin has initialized, e.g. in BootStrap where you want to register a custom filter in the correct order without dealing with the existing configured filters.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
          order - the position (see SecurityFilterPosition)

        • public static java.lang.Object doWithAuth(@java.lang.SuppressWarningsssWarnings("rawtypes") final C groovy.lang.Closure closure)

          Execute a closure with the current authentication. Assumes that there's an authentication in the http session and that the closure is running in a separate thread from the web request, so the context and authentication aren't available to the standard ThreadLocal.

          Parameters:
          closure - the code to run
          Returns:
          the closure's return value

        • public static java.lang.Object doWithAuth(java.lang.String username, @java.lang.SuppressWarningsssWarnings("rawtypes") final C groovy.lang.Closure closure)

          Authenticate as the specified user and execute the closure with that authentication. Restores the authentication to the one that was active if it exists, or clears the context otherwise.

          This is similar to run-as and switch-user but is only local to a Closure.

          Parameters:
          username - the username to authenticate as
          closure - the code to run
          Returns:
          the closure's return value

        • private static java.util.Collection<? extends org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> findInferredAuthorities(java.util.Collection<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> granted)

        • public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAfterInvocationManagerProviderNames()

          Returns:
          the names

        • public static boolean ifAllGranted(java.lang.String roles)

          Check if the current user has all of the specified roles.

          Parameters:
          roles - a comma-delimited list of role names
          Returns:
          true if the user is authenticated and has all the roles

        • private static void initializeContext()

          Called each time doWithApplicationContext() is invoked, so it's important to reset to default values when running integration and functional tests together.

          Returns:

        • public static boolean isSwitched()

          Check if the current user is switched to another user.

          Returns:
          true if logged in and switched

        • public static void loadSecondaryConfig(java.lang.String className)

          Allow a secondary plugin to add config attributes.

          Parameters:
          className - the name of the config class.

        • private static void mergeConfig(groovy.util.ConfigObject currentConfig, java.lang.String className)

          Merge in a secondary config (provided by a plugin as defaults) into the main config.

          Parameters:
          currentConfig - the current configuration
          className - the name of the config class to load

        • @java.lang.SuppressWarningsssWarnings("unchecked") private private static groovy.util.ConfigObject mergeConfig(groovy.util.ConfigObject currentConfig, groovy.util.ConfigObject secondary)

          Merge two configs together. The order is important; if secondary is not null then start with that and merge the main config on top of that. This lets the secondary config act as default values but let user-supplied values in the main config override them.

          Parameters:
          currentConfig - the main config, starting from Config.groovy
          secondary - new default values
          Returns:
          the merged configs

        • private static java.util.Map<org.springframework.security.web.util.matcher.RequestMatcher, java.util.List<javax.servlet.Filter>> mergeFilterChainMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer, javax.servlet.Filter> orderedFilters, javax.servlet.Filter filter, int order, java.util.Map<org.springframework.security.web.util.matcher.RequestMatcher, java.util.List<javax.servlet.Filter>> filterChainMap)

        • public static java.util.List<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> parseAuthoritiesString(java.lang.String roleNames)

          Split the role names and create org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthoritys for each.

          Parameters:
          roleNames - comma-delimited role names
          Returns:
          authorities (possibly empty)

        • public static void reauthenticate(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)

          Rebuild an Authentication for the given username and register it in the security context. Typically used after updating a user's authorities or other auth-cached info.

          Also removes the user from the user cache to force a refresh at next login.

          Parameters:
          username - the user's login name
          password - optional

        • public static void registerAfterInvocationProvider(java.lang.String beanName)

          Register an AfterInvocationProvider bean name.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the provider

        • public static void registerFilter(java.lang.String beanName, SecurityFilterPosition order)

          Register a filter bean name in a specified position in the chain.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building - to register at runtime (preferably in BootStrap) use clientRegisterFilter.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
          order - the position

        • public static void registerFilter(java.lang.String beanName, int order)

          Register a filter bean name in a specified position in the chain.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building - to register at runtime (preferably in BootStrap) use clientRegisterFilter.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
          order - the position (see SecurityFilterPosition)

        • public static void registerLogoutHandler(java.lang.String beanName)

          Register a logout handler bean name.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the handler

        • public static void registerProvider(java.lang.String beanName)

          Register a provider bean name.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the provider

        • public static void registerVoter(java.lang.String beanName)

          Register a voter bean name.

          Note - only for use by plugins during bean building.

          Parameters:
          beanName - the Spring bean name of the voter

        • public static void reloadSecurityConfig()

          Force a reload of the security configuration.

        • public static void resetSecurityConfig()

        • public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> retainAll(java.lang.Object granted, java.lang.Object required)

          Find authorities in granted that are also in required.

          Parameters:
          granted - the granted authorities (a collection or array of SpringSecurityUtils).
          required - the required authorities (a collection or array of SpringSecurityUtils).
          Returns:
          the authority names
